data.title: Search in File dialog cannot handle large strings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: win10

Steps to Reproduce:

I accidently pasted in a big block of text into the search box,
and whole IDE froze up.
I had to kill the process and restart it.

In this case, the text I had pasted in was the 600 line settings.json file.
Should be easily reproducable.

possible solution....
Maybe put in a max-character limit on the search input box
especially since it's a single line text field.

data.title: Cmd + 2 action is not splitting the editor when tabs is active
data.body:
On latest insiders build and Mac

Cmd + 2 action is not splitting the editor when tabs is active

data.title: Create new file - default to LF, not CRLF
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider, nightly build
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a new file
2. is CRLF by default
3. so I always have to change it's settings to LF, to keep all my project files consistently LF.

p.s.
Great work guys and gals!
I'm loving VSC.

data.title: [folding] Code Folding might be having a bug
Better support for the functional icon(color picker, etc.)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In VSCode, we have supported the display color icon.
But in fact, in order to better user experience, we may need to show more icons.

For the icon you can click on the pop-up layer to do some visualization of the operation, such as color picker(https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/625, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4329)

In this issue(https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7757), I expect to be able to support the display angle Icon.

![Firefox DevTools](https://img.alicdn.com/tps/TB1zhUgKpXXXXX0XFXXXXXXXXXX-400-171.gif)

**In Firefox, there are more icon features.**
- CSS filter editor  
  ![](https://img.alicdn.com/tps/TB1BoY3KpXXXXXmaXXXXXXXXXXX-780-341.png)
- CSS border editor https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1272148  
  ![](https://bug1272148.bmoattachments.org/attachment.cgi?id=8755272)

**Hope VSCode can be better and better** 👻 .

- [Typescript](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/typescript/src/utils/electron.ts#L37)
- Tasks (through `stdFork`)
- Debug (through `stdFork`)

data.title: [css] Support <angle> units icon in CSS

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In Firefox 49, there is an icon in the front of the angle unit, but the angle of the icon is constant. 

I hope:
- **The VSCode can be a dynamic response to the actual point of view.**
- **<kbd>Shift</kbd> + `click` to change the unit format.**

![Firefox DevTools](https://img.alicdn.com/tps/TB1zhUgKpXXXXX0XFXXXXXXXXXX-400-171.gif)

**Spec**: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values/#angles

data.title: Debugger controls overlay tabs
data.body: ![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/16109600/0b9c347c-33aa-11e6-866d-777d97555a6e.png)

data.title: "explorer.openEditors.visible":0 does not hide the "Open editors" pane
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable tabs with "workbench.showEditorTabs": true
2. Disable "Open editors" with "explorer.openEditors.visible": 0

The result is that the open editors pane does not disappear from the explorer view. It remains visible showing only one entry - the currently focused tab instead. Switching a tab changes this single entry to the newly focused tab. Setting the "explorer.openEditors.visible" to 9 or something works as intended, showing the opened documents.

data.title: Clicking on the blank (unlinked) area of a code lens line should focus and move the cursor
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  Version 1.3.0-insider (1.3.0-insider)
  57c833a81206c3d6bb99ba876e6cbafaf427b892
- OS Version:
  OS X El Capitan 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click on the non-link area of a code lens line
2. Observe that nothing at all happens

Would really like it to at a minimum to focus the editor (if not already focused), but we **really** love it if it move the cursor to the previous line. I find myself VERY often clicking on that area to start typing above it and nothing happens.

data.title: [scss] Undesirable behavior when pressing enter after completing a Sass (SCSS) statement
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider 
  Commit 0dba5abc3dcc0b69c04374dee90a2726dcbbdabf
  Date 2016-06-14T07:51:29.842Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Renderer 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Insider build 14361

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write a complete SASS statement
2. Press enter, expecting a new line
3. The first IntelliSense entry is inserted instead, which is undesirable and frustrating

I'm not sure if this happens in other languages - I noticed it when working with Sass (SCSS) files.

GIF:
![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1077648/16102345/48473d18-3323-11e6-854f-4fb5e4dff4ee.gif)

data.title: Clicking in focuses on terminal if terminal was focused when clicked out
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1, Ubuntu 12.0.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Put vs code and one other window (e.g.. Browser) side by side
2. Open a file in VS Code
3. Place cursor in Terminal
4. Click on external window
5. Click into file editting area in VS Code
6. Observe that typing will occur now in the terminal and not the clicked on file

data.title: Unable to debug TypeScript project after VSCode update.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1 / 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: Win 10 (10240)

My `launch.json`:

``` json
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.ts",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--nolazy"
            ],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "externalConsole": false,
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "outDir": "${workspaceRoot}/js"
        },
        {
            "name": "Attach",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "port": 5858
        }
    ]
}
```

My `tasks.json`:

``` json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "tsc",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "silent",
    "args": ["--target", "ES5",
             "--outDir", "js",
             "--sourceMap",
             "--watch",
             "app.ts"],
    "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
}
```

Finally my `app.ts`:

``` js
console.log('foo bar');
```

It throws the error below no matter what I'm putting in `outDir`:

``` sh
Cannot launch program 'd:\Projects\web\training\ts-in-depth\app.ts'; setting the 'outDir' attribute might help.
```

It all worked well before the update.

data.title: Add UI for editing variables
data.body:
I've added a new 'setVariableRequest' and a capability 'supportsSetVariable' to the debug protocol.
If this capability is true, the VS Code debugger should provide a UI gesture to edit the value of leafs in the variable view. The request takes the reference of the variable container, the name of the variable leaf, and the value as arguments. If the request succeeds, the new value is returned and is used as the new value of the variable. In case of failure the error should be shown in the error notification and the old value remains. 

This is the UI for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/27

data.title: Code panes crashing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: OS X 10.10.5

Steps to Reproduce:

Unfortunately I have no specific steps to reproduce this issue, but as I click in a code window (TypeScript typically) just to navigate around the code pane crashes.

It happens periodically with no apparent regularity.

data.title: Intellisense dialogue for signature help is smaller then the text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Win 10 x64

intellisense dialogue is smaller then the text and isn't scrollable so you can't see the text i.e arguments and options

![Proof](http://i.imgur.com/9628D34.png)

I guess this is the right place for this issue
https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode/issues/443

I'm not sure but could be a problem with calculating the height [Here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/8a9ddea7f979912cea99dd39369fa88e033f7d5f/src/vs/editor/contrib/parameterHints/browser/parameterHintsWidget.ts#L289) when the text is wrapped

data.title: VSC high CPU usage on startup.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Currently 1.0, have also been running into this issue on 1.2 and 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 64 bit

See attachment for CPU profiling while reloading the VSC window. 
[cpu_profile.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/317180/cpu_profile.zip)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start VSC 

Description:
Painfully slow (About 3-5 minutes) to fully start VSC. VSC will max my CPU usage on my system while starting up, after it starts up, it will dip to about 5% CPU utilization, but will jump back up to max my CPU when I am typing in an empty document.

Have tried running `code -n --disable-extensions --disable-gpu` but I am running into the same issue as well. Also tried clean installs and have reverted back to 1.0 but the issue still persists. 
System Specs:

 Operating System: Windows 10 Enterprise 64-bit (10.0, Build 10240) 
 System Manufacturer: Hewlett-Packard
 System Model: HP ZBook 15 G2
 Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4810MQ CPU @ 2.80GHz, ~2.8GHz
 Memory: 16384MB RAM
 Available OS Memory: 16042MB RAM

data.title: ctr+c isn't working in command prompt opend in VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1511 10586.318

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder in VSCode e.g. the ["Angular quickstart project"](https://angular.io/docs/ts/latest/quickstart.html)
2. Use ctrl+shift+c to open folder in command prompt
3. Execute a console program (e.g. in the Angular project run "npm start")
4. Wait until program runs
5. Use ctrl+c to stop running program

When you try to stop the running program with ctrl+c it isn't working. Tried it with the command mentioned above and also with "cordova run browser".

When you start a command prompt at the normal way it is working.

data.title: Custom theme: line number background color or border

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Win 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Show line numbers in vscode settings ("editor.lineNumbers": true)
3. Line numbers are shown with a background color same as the background color of the editor area
4. It makes confusion with indent. We do not know how well the code is indented due to the margin

Suggestion:
1. Be able to customize the background color of line number area
2. Make a thin left vertical border along the editor area

data.title: Run optimize-vscode in Travis CI
data.body:
This error seems to occur pretty frequently, we should have Travis CI run optimize-vscode so it's caught more that once a day.

```
[11:19:38] Starting 'optimize-vscode'...
evalmachine.<anonymous>:935
            throw new Error('Could not correlate define call site for needle ' + needle);
            ^

Error: Could not correlate define call site for needle node|vs/code/electron-main/|ansi-regex
    at Function.ModuleManager._findRelevantLocationInStack (evalmachine.<anonymous>:935:19)
    at evalmachine.<anonymous>:949:78
    at Array.map (native)
    at ModuleManager.getBuildInfo (evalmachine.<anonymous>:942:47)
```
